p: The H * monomers are cyclic bis-thiacarbocyanines that have an abnormally large area of a planar optical chromophore (see Ref. [ 42]). Therefore, there is a strong exciton interaction of the H * monomers in the H * dimer, which leads to the narrowing of the peak of its optical band as a result of “pumping chaos” from the peak into the wing of the band [ 16, 18, 29].
